item.title: Introducing Ristretto: A High-Performance Go Cache
item.description: This post made it to the top of Golang subreddit and is trending in top 10 on the front page of Hacker News.

item.title: Datetime Indexes in Dgraph
item.description: I recently started working at Dgraph Labs in Bengaluru as a Software Engineer. One of the first issues that I worked on was related to the Dgraph’s datetime datatype.

item.title: Semantic Versioning, Go Modules, and Databases
item.description: A little bit over a month I joined Dgraph Labs, a really cool tiny startup based (mostly) in San Francisco and Bangalore building what we believe is the next generation of Graph Databases.

item.title: How Access Control Works in Dgraph
item.description: With GDPR passing in the EU on April 14th, 2016, users on the Internet are demanding protection of their privacy and data from Internet companies.

item.title: The State of Caching in Go
item.description: Since writing this post, we have built Ristretto: A High Performance Go cache. Read all about it here. This post made it to the top of Golang subreddit and is trending #2 on the front page of Hacker News.

item.title: Optimizing Indexing in Dgraph
item.description: One of the cornerstones of Dgraph is that it allows a flexible schema, which can be modified in a live system, without any downtime.
